ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Shows how to dynamically change type of chart
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates the many kinds of Stacked chart (Stacked Mountain, Stacked Column, 100% Stacked Column) available in SciChart, and allows MS Excel style changing of data-presentation dynamically.
[b]Example Usage[/b]
[i]To change chart type - just select item in the list at the top.[/i]
- Animated/NonAnimated Zoom/Zoom Extents. - Show/Hide Labels inside columns. - Change SpacingMode : Absolute or Relative. - Change Spacing between columns using Slider. - Change DataPoinWidth using Slider. - Show/Hide series using CheckBoxes inside legend.
[b]Documentation Links[/b]
- [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/17245/41/stackedcolumnrenderableseries---stack-columns-vertically-horizontally-and-100']Introduction to Stacked Series in SciChart[/url] - [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.StackedMountainRenderableSeries.html']StackedMountainRenderableSeries Type[/url] - [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.StackedColumnRenderableSeries.html']StackedColumnRenderableSeries Type[/url]
